contentrichtext.text: {{legal policy|WP:LIBEL|WP:LBL|text=This page is also a [[Wikimedia Foundation|Wikimedia]] policy, established by [[Jimmy Wales]] and endorsed by the Foundation as necessary for the operation of the sites under its jurisdiction.}} {{nutshell|delete [[Defamation|libelous]] material when it has been identified.}} {{legal policy list}} The goal of [[Wikipedia]] is to create an [[encyclopedia|encyclopedic]] information source adhering to a [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|neutral point of view]], with all information being [[reference]]d through the [[citation]] of reliable [[published]] [[source text|sources]], so as to maintain a standard of [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiability]].<ref name="Wales_2006-05-16_WikiEN-l" /> It is the responsibility of all contributors to ensure that material posted on [[Wikipedia]] is not [[Defamation|defamatory]]. It is Wikipedia [[policy]] to delete [[Defamation|libelous]] material when it has been identified. ==Subject guidelines== If you believe that you are the subject of a libelous statement on Wikipedia, please: * '''[mailto:info-en-q@wikipedia.org E-mail]''' us with details of the article and error. ==See also== *[[Wikipedia:Contact us]] *[[Wikipedia:No legal threats]] *[[Defamation|Slander and libel]] *[[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons]] *[[Wikipedia:Legal disclaimer|Wikipedia does not give legal advice]] *[[Wikipedia:An article about yourself is nothing to be proud of]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= <!-- Order refs by Author, published, publisher --> <ref name="Wales_2006-05-16_WikiEN-l">{{cite web | url = http://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/wikien-l/2006-May/046440.html | title = [WikiEN-l] Zero information is preferred to misleading or false information | last = Wales | first = Jimmy | authorlink = Jimmy Wales | work = lists.wikimedia.org | publisher = WikiEN-l | date = 2006-05-16 | accessdate = 2010-05-21 | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5ptOvY3lx | archivedate = 2010-05-21 | quote = […] It should be removed, aggressively, unless it can be sourced. This is true of all information, but it is particularly true of negative information about living persons. […] }}</ref> }} ==External links== * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/collective/A1183394 How to avoid libel and defamation] (2004)—Information from the [[BBC]] for contributors to its defunct community website, ''Action Network'', based on the English law of libel, which differs considerably from U.S. law. Note that [[Victoria Gillick]] actually '''lost''' her libel case, the reverse of what this claims. [http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1374961/Victoria-Gillick-broke-after-losing-libel-case.html Millward, David, ''Victoria Gillick 'broke' after losing libel case'', in ''The Telegraph'', Nov. 20, 2000, 12:00AM GMT, section ''UK News''], as accessed Feb. 1, 2011. * [http://www.csmonitor.com/2002/1219/p02s01-usju.html Once it's on the Web, whose law applies?] * [http://www.internetpolicy.net/jurisdiction/ Internet policy – Jurisdiction] * [http://indigo.ie/~kwood/defamation.htm Defamation law in Ireland] * [http://news.com.com/Is+Wikipedia+safe+from+libel+liability/2100-1025_3-5984880.html "Is Wikipedia safe from libel liability?" by Daniel Terdiman] (from CNET) * [http://www.law.buffalo.edu/Academics/courses/629/computer_law_policy_articles/CompLawPapers/holland.htm Libel on the Internet: An International Problem] * [http://www.chillingeffects.org/defamation/faq.cgi Defamation FAQ at Chilling Effects Clearinghouse] __NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[pt:Wikipedia:Libelo]] [[Category:Wikipedia legal policies]]
